metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3064 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Parsing malicious or large YAML documents can consume excessive amounts of CPU or memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-gopkg-yaml.v2-dev - 0.0+git20170407.0.cd8b52f-1ubuntu2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> kubernates is in fact a kubernetes installer that calls snap, not the package it self.

criterions.comment: golang-yaml.v2 package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.0+git20170407.0.cd8b52f-1ubuntu2+esm1').
singularity-container package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
webhook package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
